units.name: Lattice
units.prompt: Control chokepoints with traps. Place them between enemy positions and your allies. Use denial to block adjacent enemy abilities. Pulse groups when possible.

units.name: Hawk
units.prompt: Stay at maximum range. Use precision_shot on the most wounded enemy to secure kills. If no one is wounded, target the enemy medic. Never move adjacent to enemies.

units.name: Bulwark
units.prompt: Advance toward the nearest enemy. Use shield_wall facing the direction with the most enemies. If an enemy is adjacent, attack them.

units.name: Viper
units.prompt: Trap the paths enemies must take to reach your backline. Stay at medium range. Use pulse on clustered enemies. Denial blocks adjacent threats.

units.name: Longshot
units.prompt: Stay at maximum range. Use precision_shot on the most wounded enemy to secure kills. If no one is wounded, target the enemy medic. Never move adjacent to enemies.

units.name: Aegis
units.prompt: Push forward aggressively. Shield_wall facing the enemy cluster. If flanked, turn to face the biggest threat. Attack when possible.

actions.thinking: All enemies are out of range (min dist 5, max range 2). I need to advance. Moving to (0,2) gets me closer to Viper at (0,5) — still out of range but reduces distance to 3. No ability available this turn.

Lattice (vector) is the only enemy in range at dist=3. I can use precision_shot (range ≤2 tiles) — wait, dist=3 means Lattice is OUT of precision_shot range. I need to move closer but must NOT go adjacent to Lattice (vector denial). Lattice is at (2,1). Moving to (2,3) puts me at dist=2, which is in precision_shot range, and not adjacent. That's a valid approach. From (2,3) I can fire precision_shot on Lattice. I haven't moved yet so no penalty.

Round 1, no enemies adjacent. Nearest enemy is Longshot at (2,3), dist 3. I should advance north toward them. Best move is (2,2) to close distance. Then use shield_wall facing N toward the cluster of enemies (Longshot and Aegis both north).

Round 1, all enemies are distant. Hawk at (0,2) is closest at dist 3, approaching along x=0 column. I should move forward and place a trap on the path Hawk will take. Moving to (0,3) puts me in range to trap (0,2) or nearby tiles. Actually, trap range is ≤2 tiles, so from (0,3) I can trap (0,2) directly in Hawk's path. This denies the approach corridor and forces enemies to route around.

Longshot is at (2,3), distance 2 from my position (2,1). I can place a trap at (2,2) where Bulwark currently stands — wait, Bulwark is there so that's occupied. I need an empty tile. (2,2) is occupied by Bulwark. I could move north to (2,2)... but Bulwark is there. Let me think: valid moves include (1,2) and (3,2) which are chokepoint tiles. If I move to (3,2), I'm adjacent to Longshot at (2,3) — that puts me in denial range of Longshot and I can block their abilities. Alternatively, I can place a trap first at (2,2) — but Bulwark is there. I could trap (3,2) from current position (dist=1, within range 2) — that's a valid empty tile on Longshot's likely path. Then stay put. Actually, placing a trap at (2,2) is blocked by Bulwark. Let me trap (3,2) — it's empty, within range 2, and on a flank path. Then I can move to (1,2) to get closer and apply denial to Viper/Longshot area. Or move first to (3,1) then trap (3,2) adjacent north. If I trap (3,2) from (2,1): distance = |3-2|+|2-1| = 2, within range. Valid. Then move to (3,1) to be closer. This puts a trap on Longshot's flank path.

Round 1, no enemies in range. Orders say push forward aggressively. Move to (2,3) to close distance with Bulwark at (2,2) — that puts me adjacent next turn. Then shield_wall facing South... wait, enemies are to my North/South. Bulwark is at (2,2), I'm moving to (2,3), so enemies are to my South. Shield_wall facing S to protect allies behind me. Actually Longshot is at (2,3) so I shouldn't move there. Move to (2,4) instead to push forward without occupying Longshot's tile. From (2,4) I'm 2 away from Bulwark. Shield_wall facing S to cover allies.

I'm adjacent to Viper which blocks precision_shot. I need to move away first. Valid moves include (1,1), (1,2), (1,3), (0,1), (0,4), (0,0). Moving to (1,1) or (1,3) gets distance from Viper. From (1,3) I'd be dist=2 from Longshot at (2,3) — in range for precision_shot. Let me move to (1,3) to get precision_shot on Longshot.

Hawk is a striker and higher threat than Bulwark sentinel. After moving to (3,3), Hawk is at dist=2, Bulwark at dist~1.4. I should target Hawk with precision_shot since strikers are higher priority. No wounded enemies, no medic on field, so target highest threat.

Aegis is at (2,4) dist=2, Longshot at (3,3) dist=2. Moving to (2,3) puts me adjacent to Aegis at (2,4) — I can attack. Longshot is to the NE, Viper to the NW. After moving I lose Fortify, but attacking Aegis is worth it. Shield_wall facing N covers Aegis direction.

Hawk is adjacent at dist=1, Bulwark at dist=2. Both in range for pulse. Pulse hits ALL units within 1 tile - that's Hawk for sure. I'm at (0,3), Hawk at (1,3). Pulse from my position hits Hawk. Wait — valid moves include (3,2) which has a trap; that tile is listed in valid moves so maybe I can move there. Actually traps are mines that trigger on enemy step, allies can walk through. (3,2) is in valid moves. If I move to (3,2), Longshot is at dist=1, in pulse range! Then pulse hits Longshot for 1 dmg. But I'd be very close to Longshot. Or attack from current position for 1 dmg, then place trap at (4,2) to control east flank. I'll attack Longshot now (range 2 attack), then move to (2,1) to reposition away from their counter.
